The Angsty Feminists in Tech Initiative

The Angsty Feminists in Tech Initiative is a web project made for and by intersectional feminists in tech. We celebrate and recognise that we are standing on the shoulders of giants: the feminists that came before us whose work led to the rights for women to work, vote, and have a voice in our society.

We do not tolerate prejudice, discrimination, or hate speech that is sexist, racist, classist, ableist, homo/bi/transphobic, or discriminatory based on religion. We champion active inclusion of our most vulnerable and oppressed communities.

Timeline

Meet the underdog pioneers of computer science and technology whose work have shaped our world as we know it, and whose faces mirror our very own. See our history through their accomplishments and contributions.

{Untitled}

An interactive resource library that connects learners (and those who support them) with initiatives that encourage participation in computing and technology.

Some External Resources

The Ping-Pong Theory of Tech Sexism

by Ariel Schrag

A true (illustrated) story about the insidious ways sexism appears in the workplace when you're a woman working in a male-dominated environment.

Not a Tech Bro, but Not a Tech Lady

by Anonymous

A queer nonbinary South Asian dreams of intersectionality in tech.

WTF is Intersectional Feminism???

by Laci Green and Franchesca Ramsey

A video breaking down what intersectionality is and why it's time for everyone to take an intersectional approach to their feminism.

This Teacher Taught His Class A Powerful Lesson About Privilege

by Nathan W. Pyle

A teacher offers a great starting point for understanding privilege with a hand's on demonstration of privilege and social mobility.

The Angsty Feminists in Tech Initiative (TAFITI) is made for intersectional feminists by intersectional feminists. Be an intersectional feminist.
